summary: This is an email chain from August 27, 2021, forwarding scanned notes and requesting that '3500 and witness folders on the Epstein share' be saved. The sender identifies as a detective with the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, and the document was scanned from a Xerox printer at 290 Broadway in New York.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The sender of the email requesting that '3500 and witness folders on the Epstein share' be saved, indicating they are part of a joint NYPD/FBI task force investigating child exploitation and human trafficking.

events.title: Email request to save Epstein case folders
events.description: A detective with the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force sends an email requesting that '3500 and witness folders on the Epstein share' be saved, attaching scanned notes.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

locations.description: Location of the Xerox Multifunction Printer used to scan and send the attached document, likely a government or office building in New York City.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 27, 2021, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
The sender is a detective with the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, highlighting interagency cooperation.
The email references '3500 and witness folders on the Epstein share,' suggesting organized digital case files containing witness information and possibly discovery materials (Rule 3500 materials).
The document was scanned from a Xerox printer at 290 Broadway in New York, providing a physical location tied to the investigation.
The subject line 'notes' and the request to save folders imply the preservation of investigative materials, possibly for legal or archival purposes.
